title: Vaccine eligibility and booking
cleaned_text: For most people, 30 June is the last day you can get a first or second Covid-19 vaccine Vaccines are our best protection against Covid-19, which is still around and can make people very ill. If you missed your Covid-19 vaccination, there's still time to book, but you need to hurry. After 30 June 2023, you will not be able to get your vaccine unless you are at higher risk from severe Covid-19. Everyone aged 5 and over can get a first and second dose of the Covid-19 vaccine. If you've only had one Covid-19 vaccination, or you've not had one at all, [book yours online](https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/covid-19/covid-19-vaccination/getting-a-booster-dose-of-the-covid-19-vaccine/) or on the phone, on 119, before 30 June - or find a walk in appointment on our vaccine bus or at a pharmacy near you - more details below. Get your COVID-19 vaccinations now The COVID-19 vaccine is free in the UK and available to everyone aged 5 and over. You do not need to be registered with a GP or prove your identity, address or immigration status to get it. - Book your appointment online through the NHS booking system via [nhs.uk/coronavirus](https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/coronavirus-vaccination/)or by calling 119 for free. When you call 119, you can speak to a translator if you need to. - Visit a a participating pharmacy for a walk-in appointment - the pharmacies in Camden currently offering vaccinations are listed further down this page. - Drop by Camden's COVID-19 vaccination bus - upcoming stops listed below - If you want to book your vaccination appointment and you have difficulties communicating or hearing, or you are a British Sign Language (BSL) user, you can use textphone 18001 119 or the NHS 119 BSL interpreter service. - If you need any other support to book, call the Council on 020 7974 4444 (option 9) Walk-in vaccination opportunities in Camden and neighbouring boroughs Below are the details for walk-in vaccination clinics in Camden. While everyone aged 5 and over can get the vaccine, not all clinics offer vaccinations to the 5 to 11-year age group. Please do contact the pharmacy beforehand to check. Walk-in clinics - Location: Aqua Pharmacy, 59 Mill Lane, West Hampstead, NW6 1NB Vaccine eligibility: Open to everyone aged 12 and over Opening times: - Monday to Friday 9am-7pm - Saturday, 9am-2pm - Sunday, 10am-2pm - Location: Essentials Pharmacy, 169 Drury Lane, WC28 5QA Vaccine eligibility: For everyone aged 18 and over Opening times: - Monday to Friday 9.30am-5.30pm (closed 1pm-2pm) - Monday to Friday 9.30am-5.30pm (closed 1pm-2pm) - Location: JP Pharmacy, 139 Camden High St, NW1 7JR Vaccine eligibility: For everyone aged 16 and over Opening times: - Monday to Saturday, 9.15am-6.15pm - Sunday, 11.15am-4.45pm - Location: Macey Chemist, 68 Mansfield Road, NW3 2HU (access at the back of pharmacy, off Courthope Road) Vaccine eligibility: Open to everyone aged 16 and over Monday to Friday 9am-2.15pm Vaccine eligibility: Open to everyone aged 12 and over - Monday, Wednesday and Friday, 9am-2.15pm - Location: Sandylight Pharmacy, 131 Queens Crescent, NW5 4EG Vaccine eligibility: Open to everyone aged 16 and over Opening times: - Monday to Thursday, 10am - 2pm - Saturdays, 10am - 4pm - Location: University College Hospital, Ground Floor Main building, 235 Euston Road, NW1 2BU - Vaccine eligibility: 1st and 2nd doses for people aged 18+ and boosters for people aged 75+ or who are immunosuppressed - Monday to Friday, 9.30am-12.30pm; 1.30pm-4.30pm - Opening times: - Vaccine eligibility: 1st and 2nd doses for children aged 5 to 18 and boosters for immunosuppressed children aged 5 to 18 years Opening times: - Thursdays 3.30pm-5.30pm Vaccine bus Camden's vaccine bus offers walk-in COVID-19 vaccinations to everyone eligible aged 12 and over, including first and second doses, boosters (Pfizer) and free flu vaccinations for those eligible for one and subject to availability. The bus runs Fridays and Saturdays, 11am to 4pm and will be available on the following days and locations. No booking required, just show up. - Location: Queen's Crescent Community Association car park (accessed via Ashdown Crescent, NW5 4QE) Dates and times: - Saturday 24 June, 11am to 4pm - Location: St Pancras Community Centre, Plender Street, NW1 0LB Dates times: - Friday 30 June, 11am to 4pm [Find out about COVID-19 vaccine events](https://northcentrallondonccg.nhs.uk/my-health/covid-19/covid-19-vaccinations-in-north-central-london/walk-in-vaccination-clinics/) happening in other North Central London boroughs, I'm not registered with a GP and/or I don't have an NHS number - can I still get vaccinated? Yes, everyone is entitled to COVID-19 vaccinations regardless of whether you're registered with a GP or not. If you aren't registered with a GP, you can complete this form at [gov.uk/government/publications/gms1](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/gms1) However, we strongly recommend you do register with a GP because it will help you access a wide range of local medical and preventative care year-round. You don't need proof of identity, address or immigration status to register. To find out more, visit your local GP surgery the
